data.event: The present town of Hobart began almost overnight on August 6, 1901, when lots on the former Kiowa-Apache-Comanche Reservation in southern Oklahoma Territory were put up for sale.
Hobart's population declined to 2936 in 1920, but resumed growing for several years afterward.
Hobart's population declined to 2936 in 1920, but resumed growing for several years afterward.
In 1950, it reached a peak of 5380.

event.title: 1950 water supply in the area was improved

data.event: In the 1950 water supply in the area was improved with a series of reservoirs; the town is connected by aqueduct to Lake Hobart several kilometres to the north.
